oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: I Want To Go With You - Hank Cochran performance - 1964-06-10 ; It Was Too Late - Shirley Collie performance
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance of I Want To Go With You, written by Hank Cochran, produced by Chet Atkins, recorded on June 10, 1964 at RCA Victor Studio in Nashville, TN, released by RCA in November 1964, and performed by Hank Cochran (vocals), Harold Bradley (guitar), Velma Smith (guitar), Jerry Reed (guitar), Buddy Emmons (steel), Roy Huskey Jr. (bass), William Ackerman (drums), and Hargus "Pig" Robbins (piano). Performance of It Was Too Late, performed by Shirley Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Cochran; Shirley Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Hank Cochran performs "I Want To Go With You" / (2:27) Shirley Collie performs "It Was Too Late"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: [Pamper Music letterhead] "What Right Have I" lyric sheet [typed], "No Tomorrow In Sight" sheet music [photo copy of handwriting], "It Was Too Late" sheet music [photo copy of handwriting], and "I Want To Go With You" sheet music [photo copy of handwriting] stored with transcription documents; Box 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cochran, Hank; Atkins, Chet, 1924-2001; Bradley, Harold (Guitarist); Smith, Velma; Reed, Jerry; Emmons, Buddy; Huskey, Roy M.; Robbins, Hargus; Collie, Shirley, 1931-2010
